item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open Cookbook for Top-Tier Code Large Language Models (327 points | 41 comments)
2. IronCalc – Open-Source Spreadsheet Engine (302 points | 88 comments)
3. Show HN: Visprex – Open-source, in-browser data visualisation tool for CSV files (93 points | 10 comments)
4. NYC Subway Station Layouts (153 points | 52 comments)
5. Show HN: Jaws – a JavaScript to WASM ahead-of-time compiler (170 points | 67 comments)
6. Zig's (.{}){} Syntax (135 points | 64 comments)
7. A skeleton made from the bones of at least eight people thousands of years apart (23 points | 4 comments)
8. FrontierMath: A benchmark for evaluating advanced mathematical reasoning in AI (89 points | 29 comments)
9. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (332 points | 69 comments)
10. Shaderblocks: Block-based image editing (24 points | 1 comment)
11. Early Cascade Injection: From Windows process creation to stealthy injection (88 points | 11 comments)
12. Grim Fandango (156 points | 49 comments)
13. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (261 points | 43 comments)
14. Hard Cases for a Handle Theory (5 points | discuss)
15. You too can write a book (97 points | 31 comments)
16. When machine learning tells the wrong story (93 points | 9 comments)
17. Texture-Less Text Rendering (184 points | 46 comments)
18. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (450 points | 169 comments)
19. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (327 points | 153 comments)
20. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (262 points | 107 comments)
21. Verbalize – text editor with writing assistance for Brazilian Portuguese (13 points | 1 comment)
22. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (174 points | 76 comments)
23. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (150 points | 57 comments)
24. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (158 points | 55 comments)
25. Notes on Guyana (124 points | 103 comments)
26. Somebody moved the UK's oldest satellite in the mid 1970s, but no one knows who (98 points | 49 comments)
27. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (289 points | 131 comments)
28. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
29. A Brief History of Cyrix (74 points | 14 comments)
30. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (44 points | 14 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 10, 2024 at 5:15 AM UTC
